yourAllocation.heading: Your personalized proposal
yourAllocation.rmUpdate: Updated by your dedicated financial advisor

description.text1: It will consist of a carefully selected group of diversified asset classes such as
description.text5: ensuring long-term capital appreciation, reduced volatility, and regular income.

description.text1: It will consist of a carefully selected group of diversified asset classes such as
description.text5: ensuring long-term capital appreciation, reduced volatility, and regular income.

capitalGrowth.label: Capital Growth
capitalGrowth.description: Illiquid investments aiming to generate long-term capital appreciation.

capitalYielding.label: Capital Yielding
capitalYielding.description: Illiquid investments aiming to generate a long-term, steady income stream.

absoluteReturn.label: Absolute Return
absoluteReturn.description: Investments into liquid strategies based on gaps in the market.

expectedReturn.label: Expected Return
expectedReturn.description: The expected annualized return taking into consideration the expected: (i) income/ yield and (ii) capital appreciation. It is the expected return once the commitments are fully deployed.

expectedYield.label: Target Income
expectedYield.description: The annual target income generated by the portfolio as a percentage of the original investment amount once the signed commitments are fully deployed.

forecastedVolatility.label: Forecasted Volatility
forecastedVolatility.description: By linking your commitments to public market benchmarks, we present the expected volatility for a public-equivalent portfolio. The actual behavior of alternative investments can vary greatly from public markets as shown by the performance during downturns.

sharpeRatio.label: Sharpe Ratio
sharpeRatio.description: Represents your portfolio's risk adjusted return by calculating the return for the excess risk divided by the forecasted volatility of the portfolio.

InplDescription.startingText: This portfolio targets growth and diversification.
InplDescription.text1: It will include a carefully selected group of diversified asset classes such as private equity and real estate, targeting long-term capital appreciation, reduced volatility and regular income.

InplDescriptionYieldDescription.startingText: This portfolio targets yield and diversification.
InplDescriptionYieldDescription.text1: It will include a carefully selected group of diversified asset classes such as real estate and private credit, targeting long-term capital appreciation, reduced volatility and regular income.

discussWithExpert.title: Discuss your proposal and invest
discussWithExpert.description: Schedule a call with your dedicated financial advisor to discuss your proposal, or click "Accept proposal and start investing" to accept your proposal.
discussWithExpert.disclaimer: This proposal will become your investment strategy after signing the commitment documents. Your strategy can be emended later in consultation with your dedicated financial advisor upon accepting your proposal.

earnings.heading: Your projected earnings
earnings.subheading: The yield from your investments will be paid quarterly in income distributions. Each investment will have its own holding period. You will be paid a series of cash sums in capital distributions as these investments exit.

income.title: Income distribution
income.description: The income your portfolio is expected to earn. This may be in the form of rental income from real estate investments, income earned from credit investments or other income generating strategies.

capital.title: Capital distribution
capital.description: The return of investment principal + the expected capital appreciation as various investments in your portfolio mature.

cumulativeDistribution.title: Cumulative distribution
cumulativeDistribution.description: The return of investment principal + the expected capital appreciation as various investments in your portfolio mature.

earnings.footerText: *Projected earnings are subject to the availability of opportunities.
earnings.pastPerformance: Past performance is not indicative of and does not guarantee future performance. Exit timelines, prices and related projections are estimates only, and exits could happen sooner or later than expected, or at a higher or lower valuation than expected, and are conditional, among other things, on certain assumptions and future performance relating to the financial and operational health of each business and macroeconomic conditions.

acceptProposalWithName.Growth: Accept your growth-driven proposal and start investing
acceptProposalWithName.Income: Accept your income-driven proposal and start investing
acceptProposalWithName.ShortTerm: Accept your short-term proposal and start investing
acceptProposalWithName.LongTerm: Accept your long-term proposal and start investing

popover.body: Schedule a call to answer your questions and discuss your proposal

error.title: An error occurred while processing your request.

tableHeaders.targetYieldToolTipText: Annual distribution percentage of the invested capital
tableHeaders.targetReturnToolTipText: Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is the annual return from invested capital over the investment period.

capitalGrowth.title: Capital Growth
capitalGrowth.capitalGrowthDesc: The capital growth strategy aims to provide access to co-investment opportunities expected to generate long-term capital appreciation in private equity and real estate alongside top global asset managers.
capitalGrowth.assetClassDesc: Deals available for investors as part of their total investment allocation are subject to the remaining available amounts.
capitalGrowth.learnMore: Learn more about our Capital Growth strategy and its exposure to different asset classes, sectors and geographies

capitalYielding.title: Capital Yielding
capitalYielding.capitalYieldingDesc: The capital yielding strategy aims to provide access to select private opportunities in real estate and private credit to generate a long-term, steady income stream.
capitalYielding.assetClassDesc: Deals available for investors as part of their total investment allocation are subject to the remaining available amounts.
capitalYielding.learnMore: Learn more about our Capital Yielding strategy and its exposure to different asset classes, sectors and geographies

opportunistic.title: Opportunistic
opportunistic.opportunisticDescription: Investments into market opportunities offering high growth potential and/or substantial yield.

absoluteReturn.title: Absolute Return
absoluteReturn.absoluteReturnDescription: Investments into predominantly liquid funds to lower overall portfolio volatility while generating a suitable level of return (typically less than other illiquid strategies).

gridData.capitalGrowthRealStateDesc: Co-investing in real estate development, refurbishment, and lease-up projects through equity, preferred equity, or non-yielding debt. These investments do not pay a yield but aim to deliver a lump sum at the end of the investment.
gridData.capitalGrowthPrivateEquityDesc: Co-investing alongside best-in-class asset managers as a minority investor in large cap companies that are not publicly traded. Strategies for value creation include: (i) leveraged buyouts, (ii) capital growth, (iii) venture capital and (iv) distressed/ special situations.
gridData.capitalGrowthPrivateCreditDesc: Investing in off-market illiquid loans to businesses through add-ons. Such private loans feature better yields and stronger covenants.
gridData.capitalYieldingRealStateDesc: Co-investing in yielding real estate properties and value-add strategies to enhance the yield of the property and its eventual sale price. We also engage in select yielding real estate debt that meet The Family Office yield requirements.
gridData.capitalYieldingPrivateCreditDesc: Co-investing alongside managers specialized in structured credits with a focus on first-lien and second-lien semi-liquid and illiquid private debt. Structured credit generally refers to different methods of debt obligation pooling and redistribution of the associated cash flows and risks meeting different investor requirements.
gridData.capitalYieldingLeasebackDesc: A type of transaction where an owner sells a real asset (real estate, aircraft, etc.) to an investor who leases the asset back to the owner. This helps the owner free capital for other purposes while providing the investor ownership of a yielding real asset.

tooltip.expectedReturn:
Internal Rate of Return (IRR) is the annual return from invested capital over the investment period. 

Multiple of Invested Capital (MOIC) is the cumulative returns over the investment period divided by the cost of the investment.
tooltip.targetYield: Annual distribution percentage of invested capital

tooltip.targetReturn: The expected annual return from invested capital over the investment period.
tooltip.targetYield: Annual distribution percentage of invested capital
tooltip.fundTerm: It is a list of important information showing how a fund is offered and governed operationally and financially.
tooltip.redemption: Redemption is the action of retrieving capital from a fund or a portfolio.
tooltip.shareClass: It is the type of shares held or examined by an investor. Different share classes might exhibit different characteristics when it comes to fees, dividends, etc.
tooltip.initialOfferingPeriod: It is the period when a fund is first being offered to investors. It might or might not be extended depending on several factors related to the discretion of the investment manager.

investingWithTFO.heading: Investing with The Family Office
investingWithTFO.title: Our performance in times of stress
investingWithTFO.listDescription: <0><1>Continuous portfolio monitoring and risk management</1><1>A dedicated financial advisor available at all times to advice on your strategy</1><1>Real time access to portfolio data and market insights</1><1>Quarterly performance and market reports</1></0>
investingWithTFO.disclaimer: Below is the historical performance of The Family Office in distressed market conditions.
investingWithTFO.disclaimerNonDesktop: Below is the historical performance of The Family Office in distressed market conditions.

legendaryText.label: Financial Crisis: Q1 2008 - Q1 2009, European Debt Crisis: Q2 2010, European Debt Crisis Worsening: Q3 2011,
legendaryText.label1: Fed Raising Interest Rates: Q4 2018, Coronavirus Pandemic: Q1 2020

investmentWork.heading: Your investment overview
investmentWork.title: Funding your investments
investmentWork.description: <0>Your capital will be deployed to opportunities over the <1>next {{year}} years*</1> in accordance with your investment strategy, and will be invested immediately to maximize return.</0>
investmentWork.disclaimer: *The deployment pace is subject to opportunity availability. Uninvested commitments will be invested in pre‐funding vehicles managed by The Family Office and subsequently used for capital calls.

languageSwitchNotificationPopUp.heading: The following step will be in English

text.description: Due to compliance regulations, the following step will be in English. Please contact us if you needed help.

multipleProposal.title: This helps us understand your priorities.
multipleProposal.incomeDescription: You have a high risk level, but have selected an income-driven strategy.
multipleProposal.shortTermDescription: You have selected short-term investment, you can however achieve higher overall returns with long-term investment.

labels.moreImportant: Which is more important to you?
labels.incomeDesc: It's important for me to receive a regular, yearly income from my portfolio rather than long-term growth.
labels.growthDesc: It's important for me to have a high-growth portfolio rather than receiving a regular annual income.
labels.shortTermDesc: I would like to focus on short-term investments
labels.longTermDesc: I would like to focus on long-term investments

labels.annualTopupAmount: I would like to increase my investment annually

errors.maxDescription: Maximum Investment cannot exceed more than 25,000,000 USD

apiError.title: Update failed
apiError.description: Sorry, we are currently unable to update your proposal. Please try again later.

tooltips.shouldGenerateIncome: Income generating strategies prioritize yield over growth and therefore drive lower growth and returns over time.
tooltips.desiredAnnualIncome: You can choose an annual income of up to 6.5% of your initial investment amount.
tooltips.topUpInvestmentAnnually: This does not directly impact your proposal but helps us plan your strategy over time.

startRiskAssessment.title: Retake risk assessment
startRiskAssessment.heading: Retake risk assessment
startRiskAssessment.subheading: All investment involves an element of risk. To propose the right portfolio for you, we need to understand your risk appetite. Please rate each statement according to how strongly you agree with it.

disclaimer.label: Disclaimer
disclaimer.consent: This proposal is provided to you by The Family Office Co.BSC(c) (“The Family Office”) for informational purposes only, and contains proprietary information that may not be reproduced, distributed to, or used by, any third parties without The Family Office’s prior written consent.

info.text1KSA: The Family Office International Investment is a joint-stock closed company owned by one person. Paid-up capital: SAR 20 million. CR No. 7007701696. It was licensed by the Capital Market Authority (No. 17-182-30) to carry out arranging, advisory and managing investments and operating funds, with respect to securities.
info.text2KSA: The Family Office International Investment is not licensed to provide credit and does not offer any such credit or lending products. All invests are subject to risks, including the possible loss of the money you invest. The investment objectives, risks, charges, expenses, and other important information are contained in the detailed offering materials; read and consider them carefully before investing.
info.text1NonKSA: The Family Office Co. BSC (c) is a Category 1 Investment Firm regulated by the Central Bank of Bahrain C.R. No. 53871 dated 21/6/2004. Paid Up Capital: US$10,000,000. The Family Office Co. BSC (c) only offers products and services to ‘accredited investors’ as defined by the Central Bank of Bahrain. The Family Office Co. BSC (c) does not offer products or services in the US.
info.text2NonKSA: The Family Office Co. BSC (c) is not licensed to provide credit and does not offer any such credit or lending products. All invests are subject to risks, including the possible loss of the money you invest. The investment objectives, risks, charges, expenses, and other important information are contained in the detailed offering materials; read and consider them carefully before investing.
info.text2: All information, figures, calculations, graphs and other numerical representations appearing in this proposal have not been audited and may be subject to change over time.  Furthermore, certain valuations (including valuations of investments) appearing in this proposal are subject to change as they may be based on either estimates or historical figures that do not reflect the latest valuation.  Although all information and opinions expressed in this proposal were obtained from sources believed to be reliable and in good faith, no representation or warranty, express or implied, is made as to their accuracy or completeness.  The information contained herein is not a substitute for a thorough due diligence investigation.  Past performance is not indicative of and does not guarantee future performance.  Exit timelines, prices and related projections are estimates only, and exits could happen sooner or later than expected, or at a higher or lower valuation than expected, and are conditional, among other things, on certain assumptions and future performance relating to the financial and operational health of each business and macroeconomic conditions.
info.text3: The Family Office makes no representation or warranty, express or implied, with respect to any statistics or historical or current financial data, whether created by The Family Office through its own research or quoted from other sources.  With respect to any such statistics or data delivered or made available by or on behalf of The Family Office, it is acknowledged that (a) the investor takes full responsibility for making its own evaluation of the materiality of the information and the integrity of the quoted source and (b) the investor has no claim against The Family Office.
info.text4: Amounts in currencies other than the US Dollar are translated using prevailing market rates as calculated by The Family Office or its service providers and may differ from the rates used by banks.  The rates are indicative only and do not reflect the rates at which The Family Office would be prepared to enter into any transactions with other parties.
info.text5: Certain information contained in this proposal constitutes “forward-looking statements,” which can be identified by the use of words such as “may,” “will,” “should,” “expect,” “anticipate,” “project,” “plans,” “estimates,” “intend,” “continue,” or “believe” or the negatives thereof or other variations thereon or comparable terminology.  To the extent this proposal contains any forecasts, projections, goals, plans and other forward-looking statements, such forward-looking statements are inherently subject to, known and unknown, significant business, economic, competitive, regulatory and other risks, contingencies and uncertainties, most of which are difficult to predict and many of which are beyond The Family Office’s control and may cause actual performance, financial results and other projections in the future to differ materially from any projections of future performance, results or achievements expressed or implied by such forward-looking statements.   Investors should not place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements.  The Family Office undertakes no obligation to update any forward-looking statements to conform to actual results or changes in The Family Office’s expectations, unless required by applicable law.
info.text6: The Family Office makes no representation or warranty, express or implied, with respect to any financial projection or forecast.  With respect to any such projection or forecast delivered or made available by or on behalf of The Family office, it is acknowledged that (a) there are uncertainties inherent in attempting to make such projections and forecasts, (b) the investor is familiar with such uncertainties, (c) the investor takes full responsibility for making its own evaluation of the adequacy and accuracy of all such projections and forecasts so furnished to it and (d) the investor has no claim against The Family Office.
info.text7: This proposal represents a summary of certain information, the full terms of which are contained in a Private Placement Memorandum that should be reviewed for a more complete understanding of the investments and their risks.  In addition, this proposal does not constitute an offer to sell, or a solicitation to buy, any instrument or other financial product, nor does it amount to a commitment by The Family Office to make such an offer at present or an indication of The Family Office’s willingness to make such an offer in the future.

thankYou.title: Thank You

inplEarnings.heading: Projected earnings from your investments*

tooltip.label: Month
tooltip.pastPerformance: Past performance is not indicative of and does not guarantee future performance. Exit timelines, prices and related projections are estimates only, and exits could happen sooner or later than expected, or at a higher or lower valuation than expected, and are conditional, among other things, on certain assumptions and future performance relating to the financial and operational health of each business and macroeconomic conditions.

inplEarnings.totalReturnDescription: <0>The projected total return on your portfolio (yield and capital appreciation) will be <1>{{amount}}</1> during the first <1>{{month}}</1> months.</0>
inplEarnings.yieldDescription: <0>The projected cumulative yield payout is <1>{{amount}}</1> during the first <1>{{month}}</1> months, paid quarterly.</0>
inplEarnings.footerText: * The projected return and yield above are based on our estimated performance of the liquid and illiquid portfolios over the deployment period.

infoDescriptions.description1: Upon signing the contract (at month 0), the initial payment (a minimum of 10% from the total investment amount) will be invested in Portfolio 2 that would target high returns. Starting month 1, the monthly/quarterly deposits begin and are accumulated in Portfolio 1 to earn a low interest rate for the duration of 6 months.
infoDescriptions.description2: Every 6 months, the payments accumulated in Portfolio 1 are shifted to Portfolio 2 and allocated to opportunities that are aligned with your investment style and goals (with the minimum of $10.000 for each opportunity) to achieve higher returns.
infoDescriptions.description3: Every quarter, you receive yields from the investments in Portfolio 2.
infoDescriptions.description4: The process continues until the end of the investment period.
